title: Scaling
body: Scaling is a common dental procedure for patients with gum disease. This is a type of dental cleaning that reaches below the gum line to remove plaque buildup.

title: Root Canal Treatment
body: A root canal is a treatment used to repair and save a tooth that is badly decayed or becomes infected.

title: Dental Bridges
body: A bridge is a fixed dental restoration used to replace one or more missing teeth by joining an artificial tooth definitively to adjacent teeth or dental implants.

title: Root Planning
body: Scaling and root planing, also known as conventional periodontal therapy, non-surgical periodontal therapy, or deep cleaning

title: Complete Dentures
body: A complete denture is a removable appliance used when all teeth within a jaw have been lost and need to be prosthetically replaced.

title: Midline Diastema
body: Midline diastema is a space between the maxillary and/or mandibular central incisors. Midline diastema can be due to various causes such as genetic, environmental, and so on.

title: Pulpectomy
body: A pulpotomy is the removal of a portion of the pulp, including the diseased aspect, with the intent of maintaining the vitality of the remaining pulpal tissue by means of a therapeutic dressing.

title: Oral and maxillofacial surgery
body: Oral and maxillofacial surgery specializes in surgery of the face, mouth, and jaws. It is an internationally recognized surgical specialty.

title: Implant treatment
body: A dental implant is a surgical component that interfaces with the bone of the jaw or skull to support a dental prosthesis such as a crown, bridge, denture
